title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Go to the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one. 4. Observe that there are no children nodes listed. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
